website_summaries.verdict: A worthy towel set with many fans. The best on the market.

customer_reviews.title: But they don't absorb water!
customer_reviews.text: The towels are very pretty, and I put them out for show a la company. HOWEVER: they do not absorb water! So frustrating. I bought a new set of wine glasses at Crate and Barrel. Washed them all in hot soapy water. And tried to dry them with these towels - about as useful as burlap absorption-wise. I recommend the old flour sack versions for kitchen towels - now THEY absorb.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Adler

customer_reviews.title: A nice looking towel with no functional abilities
customer_reviews.text: If you like smearing things around your dishes, these are the towels for you. They are about as absorbent as tile flooring. If you want a nice looking thin towel, this is fine. If you want a towel that absorbs then look elsewhere. I feel like this was a wasted purchase. Poor quality products are unfortunately becoming the norm on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Altered Steaks

customer_reviews.title: They help me to save money.
customer_reviews.text: For years I was using paper towels to dry my hands and wipe water off counter tops, etc. I was spending 12,14,16 dollars for a package of towels that might last me a month or two. Then I got smart and decided to start using these cloth towels. They are very absorbent. I still use paper towels to clean messy things. But now, I use one of these towels to dry my hands and another towel to dry dishes, etc. In the long run, they have saved me some money. They paid for themselves after only two months.
customer_reviews.author: 3rdGen

customer_reviews.title: I should have listened to other reviewers
customer_reviews.text: Perhaps after more washings they will dry better, I am hoping so. For now, they have been washed, but they only smear water around on whatever you are trying to dry. If they improve, I will update, but for now, I do not like them at all.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Camper

customer_reviews.title: Price gouging sellers!
customer_reviews.text: These are quite nice tea towels but have doubled in price over the past week...price gouging in this time of need. Some are buying to conserve paper towel use or some of us are making face masks for medical personnel and neighbors. Shame on these sellers!!!
customer_reviews.author: BHMMary

customer_reviews.title: Very nice! I was impressed with the quality
customer_reviews.text: Very nice! I was impressed with the quality. So much better than what your local retail store sells. Good large size. Received it on time, well packaged (comes with a personalized note from the President of Harringdons). I have washed them a few times now, and they are still as good as new. Good for drying plates and fruits etc and I can also use them to clean spills in the kitchen. Definitely a great X-Mas gift. Will be sending one to my sister soon.
customer_reviews.author: purple80

customer_reviews.title: Towels are not the same as they used to be.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this towel for embroidery for several years now and loved them. My recent order was bad—dirty looking and spotted. Sent them back and got another set. Same thing. Decided to wash them. Wrong decision. Now I am stuck with them. They are not even good enough for rags. I did notice they are not the same as my others ones. Made from a different source. When you have something good stick to it. Please get the good ones back again.
customer_reviews.author: Max Gamon

customer_reviews.title: Not Absorbent Enough to be Practical
customer_reviews.text: Quite large, but not absorbent. If you use these to dry your hands or wipe up wet spots, you're better off with something thicker. I had a large wet spot on the counter, wiped it with one, then grabbed my old, stained, heavy weave to actually get up the water ;-) On hands it's about the same level of dryness you get from using the auto-allotment of paper towel in a public restroom. I will probably use them as napkins, instead.
customer_reviews.author: Bama Bookworm

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Kitchen Towel
customer_reviews.text: I use my Harringdons to dry pots, pans, covers, plus wipe my clean wet hands. I soak all new fabric for days in a bucket with laundry soap, and I never use softeners. This life long tradition is an essential step in preparing any fabric I buy for maximum comfort and absorption. Harringdons towels absorb quickly and the large size lets me use the towel in both hands at the same time while drying even my largest pots and covers. I appreciate the hanging loop in the corner and not in the middle. Really like getting a set of 12 so I don't have to economize. Love, love, love them.
customer_reviews.author: VALEREE HANSEN

customer_reviews.title: Not Sure What All The Excitement Was
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these towels based on the raving reviews - well as soon as I opened them they weren't as others have described. Especially when it comes to thickness. These are a medium thickness at best. I'm sure they would have done the job but I've purchased better quality so these went back to looking for a towel that's a bit thicker then these.
customer_reviews.author: OneSpiritGal

customer_reviews.title: A nice towel with a vintage appeal
customer_reviews.text: I liked these towels. I purchased them because of their vintage appeal. I followed the seller’s instructions and washed them adding vinegar to the water, I put them in the dryer, and while still damp let them finish drying on the clothesline. I embroidered on them and my designs were micely displayed on them. I’m not opposed to repurchasing them again, but I think I like a flat weave cotton better. Just personal preface. I liked these towels, they washed and dried very well and I would recommend them to others. I have no complaints about the quality and workmanship of these towels.
customer_reviews.author: CornbreadnRice

customer_reviews.title: high quality as promised
customer_reviews.text: I got these on a good deal on Black Friday for around $25, so they are especially worthy of that price. However, having used them and seen them in person, I would say that if I ran out of them for some reason I might very well pay full price for these. They are a good tight herringbone weave, very attractive in a simple way. I like that they have a hanging strap sewn onto the corner. They are a generous size and wash up well so far. If you want them crisp you will have to iron them, but I leave them naturally laundered and just fold. Great dish/everything else towels.
customer_reviews.author: Samus Aran

customer_reviews.title: These are the cotton sack towels you've been looking for
customer_reviews.text: These are great quality, pretty, and wash well. I didn't realize that the stripes are down the long side and not across the bottom, but that's even more cool for my intention to embroider in the middle. I've used a few already as dish towels and for cooling baked goods and they're really nice.
customer_reviews.author: Heartofthematter

customer_reviews.title: After only a few washes they shrunk horribly and have developed holes
customer_reviews.text: These looked great at first. I live alone, I know how to cook and thus do not overuse or abuse hand towels. I am shocked at poor the quality is of these towel. The shrinking I could accept, even expect but to have holes developing in the material is unacceptable after only 3 washes. I am very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: J-Cinco

customer_reviews.title: High Quality Multi-Purpose Kitchen Towels!
customer_reviews.text: PROS: • Multi-purpose use, from drying your hands to drying the dishes or used a decorative piece in the kitchen • Beautiful design with vibrant color stripes running along the side • Good quality towels that are absorbent and actually dry your hands fairly well and mop up liquid messes in an instant • Corner hanging strap to hang and dry the towels • No damage after 1 year of constant usage and washing • Generous sized towels that can handle any mess • No noticeable shrinkage after frequent washes • A great alternative to buying and wasting paper towels CONS: • Permanent wrinkles along the edges after wash
customer_reviews.author: Slim

customer_reviews.title: Wish they had an option for colored towels
customer_reviews.text: These are good sized towels, you get plenty of them, and they are fairly absorbent. I'm used to more absorbent towels, but those have the downside of leaving lint and usually get less absorbent over time. I took a star off because I don't do special laundry instructions. I'm not going to bleach them (I have very little white laundry) and I dry everything on high. This means I've ended up with stained and slightly shrunken towels. I can live with that, but if they had a colored option I'd have given them 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanette J.

customer_reviews.title: Thick, attractive towels
customer_reviews.text: I doubt that I'll ever have to buy tea towels again--12 of these towels will probably last for many years. They are a good, hefty weight, which I like, and have a nice broad stripe along each side to add a dash of color in the kitchen. Some reviewers complained about absorbency--which I understand. At first use, they are a little questionable, but as they're laundered, they soften up and do a better job. They do wrinkle a bit, which doesn't bother me in the slightest--they're towels, not dress shirts. I think they'd make a nice housewarming gift.
customer_reviews.author: Cecilia P

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: I am a bit of a snob when it comes to tea towels. All my favorites were wearing out that I’ve had for years. I like them to be lint free, absorbent and soft. These fit the bill!! They are all of those things plus they’re a nice weight-not too thin! I was a little worried about the colors but when they’re tri-folded, you can’t see the stripes anyway. I highly recommend these towels and am very happy!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best dish towels I've found
customer_reviews.text: Growing up, my mother always used flour sack towels for tea towels, for general drying & cleaning in the kitchen. I have found over the last few years it is so hard to find good quality ones that actually dry dishes well. I took a chance on these, based on other reviews, & boy am I happy I did! Nice thick towels, generous size, very absorbent. Important to wash them without fabric softener, I will continue to follow directions & hope these towels last many years in our household!
customer_reviews.author: catgirl74

customer_reviews.title: Very nice towels and nice packaging.
customer_reviews.text: These towels arrived in very nice packaging with tissue layers between each different color (3) of towel. It included a nice message from he company. It has a loop, which looks as though it will be very sturdy. Since I just received these towels, I can't say from experience how durable they will be on the long run. I can say I pre-soaked half the towels in salt and vinegar for 24 hrs, as suggested by other reviewers and then washed on cotton setting and dried on regular setting. They came out very well and not very wrinkled. I think these towels probably deserve the score of 5 overall, that they have received.
customer_reviews.author: riverrat218

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying the cheaper towels for machine embroidery but found they are flimsy and defective. I use these for gifts, such as, shower, wedding and even birthday gifts. When you look at the price of $3 per towel the quality cannot be beat with the cheaper. They embroider beautifully and proud to give them as gifts.
customer_reviews.author: Lynda Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased these multiple times now and each time I am very happy with my purchase. I use them to embroider for gifts and everyone is always very happy with the Dish Towels. I do wash and iron them as they are gifts but I have several that I have kept for myself and ironing is not necessary. I recently had a stain on one that required me to use bleach on it which I don't usually do the stain came out but the colors on the towels remained unchanged! Will buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Burton

customer_reviews.title: High quality material and durable Towels
customer_reviews.text: I am a Culinary Arts Student in College and really search for the highest quality and durable products. I wish someone would have told me about these Towels before. They are such a good buy. I use them all over and around the kitchen for assisting my cooking and cleaning process. Excellent materials and good size. Great value for the price. I would definitely recommend this product to other Culinary students, Chefs, Restaurant owners and cooks in general. Thanks Harringdons for surpassing my expectations
customer_reviews.author: BC

customer_reviews.title: Surprised by quality.
customer_reviews.text: These towels just arrived. They are beautifully packaged including a nice note from the company. The quality is very good, especially at a very reasonable price. I plan to use them as embroidery "blanks" for Christmas gifts. I had been concerned that the fabric would be thin and not appropriate for embroidery; no worry with that. The fabric is sturdy and absorbent Thank you, Harringdons. Amazon delivered quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper in Seattle

customer_reviews.title: Returned
customer_reviews.text: I returned these towels because they were just too thin. They are very pretty and would probably work well for decorating, but I was looking for towels to dry dishes.
customer_reviews.author: Bargersville shopper

customer_reviews.title: Check These Towels After Washing
customer_reviews.text: I am mostly happy with this purchase. The material of the towels seems to be of good quality and I like the fact that the design runs the length of the towel. When you fold or roll them the design is displayed. I would have given this product 5 stars but I noticed that the borders of the towels are uneven after washing. On some of the towels the unevenness is significant. If I were hanging them for display that would be a problem. Since the towels are not for decorative purposes I will make the best of it.
customer_reviews.author: Deepthinker

customer_reviews.title: Not as shown in picture
customer_reviews.text: These towels are just ok as dish towels go. First they are not as shown in the picture bc the stripe is going straight down each side of the long side of the towel not across the top of the towel, which makes a difference to me since I like to display my towels. They are somewhat absorbent after being washed several times but not all that great, but they are so wrinkled after using them to dry dishes that I just want to hide them. The thing they ARE good for though, is covering dough or food preparation bc they leave no lint. I was somewhat disappointed with these.
customer_reviews.author: Bunnie

customer_reviews.title: Pretty but wrinkle like crazy
customer_reviews.text: I like the updated yet classic and simple look of these towels. The absorption is adequate for my kitchen uses (primarily used to dry hands or dishes). What I don't love is that they wrinkle up like crazy in the laundry. The only thing I found that works pretty good is to wash, shake them out (make them snap), and then hang to dry. This seems to minimize wrinkles enough that I don't feel like I need to iron them. I'm definitely not ironing my kitchen towels!
customer_reviews.author: E Greenwood

customer_reviews.title: Quality and Beauty
customer_reviews.text: These towels are amazing: soft, highly absorbent and excellent quality cotton with a luxurious weave. No comparison to bar mops or grocery store towels: these have none of the lint or shedding, are very soft and absorbent. Love the generous size (shrinkage allowance), and the sewn in loop on the corners of each towel. The colors are vibrant and beautiful, and are color-fast: they hold up just fine with a (moderate amount) of bleach. I use 3/4 cup chlorine bleach per wash load of towels, and have experienced no problems with the colors. Can't say enough about these amazing towels-in fact, I plan on buying additional sets as gifts!
customer_reviews.author: Asfoora

customer_reviews.title: A multipurpose cloth towel
customer_reviews.text: At first I thought, wow, that's a whole lot of towels I bought but now I have one hanging on a hook (see my review of hooks,) by all the sinks in my house - bathroom, kitchen, laundry room. They are absorbent and wash well. I gave them minus one star because on first washing them in hot water before I used them they did fade and some the edges folded over. A person might iron them to make look more crisp, but not this person.
customer_reviews.author: Picklegirl

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and size
customer_reviews.text: quality of dish cloth -perfect for drying but especially great for glassware! I love the colors striped on them and have ordered more for gifts. They wash well and retain their large size -great item and highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mamaglobird

customer_reviews.title: Super quality and value
customer_reviews.text: I love these. Im super fussy about my tea towels and these hit all the desirable factors for me. The quality of the cloth is great, thick and absorbent with a lovely herringbone weave. i washed them all first but kept one unwashed. shrinkage was minimal and the the absorption factor went up drastically, so wash first before use. They turned out fluffy and maintained quality. I washed and dried on delicate cycle for both. they have a hanging loop also! the design is clean and looks very professional. they look great over food and in bread baskets. i will be buying again. Not to mention the value for money! super satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: MaSher

customer_reviews.title: Product unfinished
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited about this product after reading so many great reviews and after a long search for the perfect kitchen towels. While I do think they are nice towels, I was sad to see that about six from my pack have a side that isn’t finished or hemmed. Will likely be returning these and on the hunt again :(
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Pratt

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the extra cost
customer_reviews.text: These towels, which are more expensive that normal are no more absorbent than than all the other ones I have. I emailed Harringdons to see if these towels need conditioning to be absorbent...for example wash towels twice before use or whatever...no response to my email. I've just wasted my money on these..
customer_reviews.author: Henry Czerwonka

customer_reviews.title: Absorbent. Edges curl.
customer_reviews.text: Absorbent, but the edges curl up. The fabric is on the thin side compared to other towels that I have but not too thin. In fact, easier to get into a wine glass than thicker towels. I don’t know why some towels have edges that curl up and others don’t, Perhaps something in the way the edge is stitched. The price on these is good, the colored stripes are pleasant. Not sure I would buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: BK 1979

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality, size and appearance
customer_reviews.text: So far, I'm very happy with these! I washed them twice before use and I plan to use them only for drying dishes and wash them separate from other towels. My hope is that they won't get stinky and they'll keep their absorbancey. So far they are just as absorbant as my stinky old Norwex towels were before they became stinky. These are much more affordable too. They are also beautiful in my opinion... and large!
customer_reviews.author: AKN

customer_reviews.title: Well liked and respected
customer_reviews.text: Maybe important to know that I, myself have not yet embroidered on these towels yet. But I was so impressed with the size, color and feel of the fabric that I wrote up a post for my embroidery group on Facebook. Over the course of 3 days, there were over 250 comments from embroidering sewers about how wonderful these towels are; how sometimes they shrink but not that much and how lovely they look once the work is done. I'm doing one tomorrow and will update but it was pretty amazing to see that many people comment on how wonderful they were.
customer_reviews.author: Joann Donahue

customer_reviews.title: Pretty but not super high quality
customer_reviews.text: These are very pretty towels. The weave is nice and the Frenchish stripes are cute. I washed them upon receipt and there were a lot of stray threads that had to be trimmed. They were fairly wrinkled fresh from the dryer but they seemed to smooth out ok with a cool iron. They are pretty absorbant for drying dishes. Overall, good but not great. If it wasn’t for the time I spent trimming loose threads, I’d give them 4 out of 5, but I expected more for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa S.

customer_reviews.title: Great dish cloths
customer_reviews.text: They're oversized which is great when wiping down large items. I initially washed the towels in cold before I used them to prevent shrinking or becoming misshapen; after that, I wash them in hot when I do laundry. I do NOT use a dryer sheet because I feel it prevents the towels from being as absorbent as they should be. Also, I stretch/smooth out the wrinkled edges before I toss them in the dryer; they'll still be somewhat wrinkly, but I don't believe in ironing dish towels. These are really great dish drying towels and I would purchase them again.
customer_reviews.author: J Rosales

customer_reviews.title: very high quality tea towels
customer_reviews.text: These tea towels are so much nicer than I expected. You can see and especially feel the quality of these towels. These are far better than anything you can find in retail stores - at least the ones in my general area. The stripe colors are vibrant and they are woven into the fabric and the size of the towels is more than adequate. I am sure I will enjoy using these towels for many years. They will also be super for wrapping a kitchen type gift - especially for a wedding shower. So happy I found these.
customer_reviews.author: Sue from the South

customer_reviews.title: They have a nice weight to them and I did not experience any ...
customer_reviews.text: These towels are exactly what I expected. They have a nice weight to them and I did not experience any problems with the stitching that others had complained about. I followed the sellers recommendations for washing the towels prior to use and are now in daily use as dish towels and all the other uses of a nice set of tea towels. I am very pleased with my purchase. The manufacturer hoped that the look and quality of the towels exceeded my expectations, which it did not. I have high expectations for the products that I buy and these towels have met my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: D. Carr

customer_reviews.title: Worked great!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these towels to put my embroidery on. They worked great. One has my Mom's handwritten recipe and the other has my grandchildren's hand prints. I was very pleased with the outcome. Just the right weight and size. I have lots of siblings to share with, so getting lots of towels in a bundle was a bonus. Will definitely order again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I'm very picky about things like dish towels
customer_reviews.text: I'm very picky about things like dish towels, which so often disappoint despite their seemingly simple function. These are absorbent, a good weight and not too thin, the size is right, and the colors and design are attractive. Many towels smear the water around, are too small to wrap around a plate or glass, are thin and don't wash well. I've washed these several times and they haven't shown any signs of fraying or dinginess. I'd buy them again and recommend without reservations.
customer_reviews.author: sonic mom

customer_reviews.title: My go-to towel
customer_reviews.text: I've had my latest set of these for five years. Some are stained but most can be sun-bleached when needed. Of the two sets I've bought over the last decade, I've only had 1 relegated to the rag bag for a developed hole. I use them to dry dishes, cover rising bread dough, and clean up kid messes. I've received some with machine embroidered designs on them as gifts and the tight weave seems to handle high stitch count designs very well.
customer_reviews.author: TwinsForMeToday

customer_reviews.title: To my surprise and delight, these towels are just as good
customer_reviews.text: I have only ever purchased William Sonoma kitchen towels but thought I would try something new. I wanted the same quality and absorption but fresh colors in my kitchen. To my surprise and delight, these towels are just as good! I will be using these from now on! Thankful to those who wrote all the wonderful reviews before me. It is because of all of those reviews that I gave the towels a try. The colors are vibrant and cheerful. They fit right into the Kon Mari make over and help bring joy to drying all the dishes! :)
customer_reviews.author: Wendy E

customer_reviews.title: Very Impressed
customer_reviews.text: I like how quickly I received these kitchen towels. I washed and dried as directed (no laundry softener added). I did have to Google what water temperature is 104°. Its warm not hot. 😁 I used my towel last night to dry dishes and was very impressed at how well they dried and also how dry the towel stayed. The towel wasn't soaking wet. No lint on dishes. Absorbed water with one wipe. Very happy with my purchase. Thanks for the included tips on the multiple uses of the cotton towels. Bonus!
customer_reviews.author: Constance Blackwell

customer_reviews.title: These towels do not absorb well & wrinkle.
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed with this purchase. I bought some dish towels a year ago & I was so happy with them I wanted to reorder them. They no longer were available so I ordered these because they seemed the closest to the same thing. The ones I bought a year ago dried dishes wonderfully. They washed like bran new each time. Never wrinkled. Always looked beautiful These towels do not absorb the water nearly as well. They wrinkle along the edges. I hope as time goes on they will get better. Please bring the other ones back.
customer_reviews.author: Willa Jean

customer_reviews.title: Not absorbant
customer_reviews.text: I'd spend more for another brand or live with fewer towels instead. These are not absorbent, which I read in other reviews, but I assumed that must be relative to better towels. Nope. They really don't soak up much water. And the little water they do collect never seems to dry.
customer_reviews.author: Julianne Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Well Made, Look Good, Adequate for Dish Drying
customer_reviews.text: I waited until I had washed my dish towels 4 or 5 times before writing this review. The stitching along the edges has remained intact. The towels are as absorbent as expected, which will never be as absorbent as microfiber or terry cloth. The more they are washed, the more absorbent and less wrinkled they become. All things considered, these towels are worth the money. The 1 star review people must have been shipped towels from somewhere else.
customer_reviews.author: Jody

customer_reviews.title: Quality towel
customer_reviews.text: I am really delighted with these towels. I am a baker and do a lot of meal prep. I really use a lot of towels for large meals. These are perfect! I am a big fan and like the close weave and weight, particularly for vegetables and baking. They wash well and so far have no stains. I do always add baking soda to help clean my laundry. They keep their shape and fold evenly. Great product.!
customer_reviews.author: R@dm0m@

customer_reviews.title: This is a nice large, absorbant DISH TOWEL!
customer_reviews.text: I was confused when shopping for dish towels. Some vendors interchanged the name DISH CLOTH and DISH TOWEL. I was shopping for a DISH TOWEL and this is what I got... A nice, generously sized, dish towel. Vendors need to understand, Americans consider DISH CLOTHS to be smaller, square cloths used to wash dishes and wipe up counters, and consider DISH TOWELS to be larger, rectangular cloths used for drying. These are GREAT DISH TOWELS!
customer_reviews.author: JEF

customer_reviews.title: Pretty dish towels
customer_reviews.text: I use dish towels as napkins rather than using paper napkins for their size and absorbency and to decrease the amount of trash we generate. I just received these towels and have not used them yet. However, I have washed them and they came out of the dryer fairly wrinkle-free and with minimal, if any, shrinkage. I got the 3 color variety and they are bright and cheery looking. Now I have to talk myself into letting anyone wipe their messy hands on them!
customer_reviews.author: SanderlingSunshine

customer_reviews.title: Not Very Absorbent
customer_reviews.text: If you are buying these to use for spills, wiping counters, washing your hands, cleaning counters, etc, these towels are not very absorbent and I do not care for them for that. However if you are looking for one to embroider or using these more like napkins or want to include them in a gift basket, they are nice for that. I like the size of them but for my needs, I want something that absorbs.
customer_reviews.author: C.S.

customer_reviews.title: hefty absorbant fabric
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving these towels as a gift. I pre-washed them according to the directions so my friend could use them right from the gift bag.. They have a nice hefty feel coming from the dryer. What I don't like is that they curl along the lengthwise hemmed edges. I am not going to iron kitchen towels, even for a friend. I'm keeping a few for myself as I appreciate the quality of these towels.
customer_reviews.author: Phoebe

customer_reviews.title: Lovely towels
customer_reviews.text: Like the description says "There's no Substitute for Quality". That pretty much says it all. These are every bit as nice as the towels sold at William Sonoma for more than twice the price. These towels are soft, absorbent, wash well, and they are pretty. I use them as hand towels in my bathrooms as well as in my kitchen. I would not hesitate to give them as gifts. Bought a second set of these. I just love them. The more you wash them the better they get.
customer_reviews.author: JJO

customer_reviews.title: If you just want a rag, this is for you.
customer_reviews.text: I just received, so don't know about durability, or function, but if you are looking for those things AND a handsomely cute towel, you won't find cute here. There is nothing about these that you want to have lying across your nice new countertops, or have in your cute kitchen. If you don't care about that, and just want a rag to use, then you may like. After washing, they look even worse. I'm sure they will function ok, just was looking for something that actually looked good too.
customer_reviews.author: Bottomline

customer_reviews.title: A+ for absorbency,  durability, large size!
customer_reviews.text: These towels work great for everything - terrific absorbency and so easy to keep sparkling white and clean with a hot wash in bleach. Bleach doesn't damage colored border to any noticeable extent, and towels come out of dryer clean, fresh and bright with no stains. So practical. No fraying edges and a tab at one corner for hanging. Everything about them was well planned. LOVE THESE TOWELS.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy H

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful towels.
customer_reviews.text: Love Love Love these towels. They are so durable and absorbent and almost heavy duty. I admit I was skeptical at first when choosing towels. They seem to be so pricey and then you get a crappy towel, but I took a chance on these and I am super happy with them. I just use them for regular dish towels (drying dishes, drying hands) but also for wrapping warm tortillas or warm biscuits. They wash up wonderfully and I also thought I would be worried that I would just ruin the white color, but because they wash so well they stay nice all of the time. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Lirpaleigh

customer_reviews.title: Useful, and plentiful
customer_reviews.text: Use them every day. Haven't even used them all yet as I wash once a week, but I have one in a hook that I use to dry my hands until it gets dirty. I also use them on dough that needs to rise. I also use then when laying things out (like bread loafs, or dishes.) I do wish they were a tiny bit more absorbant, but I wonder if that would negatively affect their other uses.
customer_reviews.author: Phoenix

customer_reviews.title: I cannot say enough good things
customer_reviews.text: I cannot say enough good things about these dish towels. I was looking for a good, quality plain weave towel to embroider on. These are excellent. They are absorbent, just the right weight and feel. Harringdons emailed me instructions to wash and dry the towels before use. I followed their instructions, and could not be happier. I definitely recommend these towels.
customer_reviews.author: MD

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: I needed towels for my kitchen to cut down on some of the paper towel use and these are exactly what I was looking for. They are 100% cotton, super absorbent and they do exactly what I wanted them to. If you are worried about wrinkles, they can be ironed as well. I am more about the functionality and these meet all of those. They are a good size as well. Happy I made this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: W. T. Langley

customer_reviews.title: Great value and quality
customer_reviews.text: Great quality towels. Like all towels you want to be absorbent, wash without fabric softener to ensure max absorbency. They wash nicely and have kept their shape and quality, and I think they will last a long time. I think you get more than what you pay for with these - you can easily spend more elsewhere and receive less towels of lesser quality. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: AMGS

customer_reviews.title: Would not order again
customer_reviews.text: They are absorbent but stains are not easily removed. The ends curl over so they look like they need to be ironed. Who wants to iron kitchen towels? And now I am finding the towels are wearing out, showing holes. I would return if possible
customer_reviews.author: balovestocook

customer_reviews.title: These are the BEST!
customer_reviews.text: I'm very fussy about dish towels. They need to DRY items, and they need to dry glassware SMUDGE-FREE. After trying a few others, I bought these. I LOVE THEM so much. I plan to get them as gifts for others, and I will definitely buy more for my own use. I especially love them for glassware -- you get a quick dry with no smudges. They are easy to wash and dry. They are a bit wrinkled out of the dryer, but I do not care about that because they work so well. They are pretty too! I can't recommend these highly enough.
customer_reviews.author: L.S.

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted some nice dish towels to embroider for gifts. I wanted them to be useful, as well, and was worried about how absorbent they would be. I immediately washed and dried them twice once received. There was minimal shrinkage and they came out "puffy" with minimal wrinkles. I ironed them since I plan to embroider them but would not have had to for normal use. I sprinkled water on them and they immediately absorbed the water without beading or running off. I am extremely pleased and ordered more.
customer_reviews.author: Andi

customer_reviews.title: Best have ordered or found-quality!
customer_reviews.text: The only thing didn’t like was waiting 4 days to get a Prime item! Couldn’t believe it. The quality in construction & manufacturing fabric is there. Well worth the price & wouldn’t hesitate to order again & plan to when need arises. May consider for gift giving as comes with sheets separating different colors. Nicely presented. Amazon makes gift giving easy! Just apparently need to allow extra time for this Prime item.
customer_reviews.author: J Whitmer

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT QUALITY
customer_reviews.text: These towels are well constructed, made of an excellent fabric, and definitely worth the money. I found only one tiny flaw in the stitching on one (1) towel which was very easy to fix. They give you care instructions which include the suggestion not to use fabric softener because it makes them less absorbent. Even without the softener, they do not have wrinkles when washed.
customer_reviews.author: Alyce

customer_reviews.title: By Far Superior!
customer_reviews.text: I'm going to stitch on these towels for gifting. I bought two different brands & the Harringdons towel is by far superior! I'm not quoting on absorbency since I haven't dried w/them but I can say that the shrinkage is very nominal. I look forward to seeing the final product! You have something to be proud of here & I'm glad I found you. Thanks to all.
customer_reviews.author: C Hill

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: The first thing I noticed was how heavy the box was. Because of the weight, I was not expecting towels when I opened the box. You can purchases cheaper towels, but you will not get the same quality. I am very pleased. I ordered some cheaper dish towels a few weeks ago and was not happy. I decided to give these a go and they exceed everything I was expecting. The material is very thick and heavy. They worked very well drying my dishes, and were barely damp. I recommend spending the few extra dollars and buy these towels. They are well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: TIM A. KEGLEY

customer_reviews.title: Great large, absorbent kitchen towel
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing like a 100% cotton towel for use in the kitchen. This one exceeded my expectations in size. It's simplicity of design (with red, green or blue stripes down the sides of each towel) make it compatible with many decors. And I love the fact that I will be able to bleach them should they acquire food stains on them. Very useful
customer_reviews.author: Ellie

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the towels to do machine embroidery on them to sell at craft shows. They washed nicely and good quality cotton towel. They worked well for machine embroidery.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better than microfiber
customer_reviews.text: I like the retro look. I washed them as recommended by the little card that came with my Harringdon's towells. Once my washing machine filled with the rince water, I stopped my machine and let the towels submerged in water over night. I started the machine the next morning, then dried them on low. I took them out of the dryer immediately and folded them. I soaked them overnight after reading all of the results. I don't know if soaking them overnight is the reason I didn't have a problem with them, but all I can say is, I found them to be very absorbent.
customer_reviews.author: Evelyn

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality kitchen towels
customer_reviews.text: These towels are very absorbent and do a great job. I washed them before first use, as per the instructions, and there was no noticeable shrinkage. I highly recommend them!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen M. Adams

customer_reviews.title: Great utility towels.
customer_reviews.text: Good towel for my purpose of drying dishes...not for display. Washed in cold water, dried on low, no fabric softener...only shrunk 1 inch. 100% cotton so I expected this and some wrinkling. Very good utility towels. Would have given 5 stars if they were suitable for display on oven door.
customer_reviews.author: Brm Candles Carolyn Stoner

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy them
customer_reviews.text: You can't get stains out even using bleach products, they r terrible!
customer_reviews.author: SALLY FROEHLE

customer_reviews.title: Good absorbency
customer_reviews.text: I really like these dish cloths. They are oversized and wipe items dry - they don't just move the water around. The only down side is that after washing and drying, they come out very wrinkled. If I really cared, I could iron them - but, I'm not that fussy. This is a good towel and would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Oliver

customer_reviews.title: We love them.
customer_reviews.text: We love them...and use them mainly for kitchen hand towels, as they are so very absorbent, a generous size,.and dry easily hanging on the oven door handle bar. It's great having a good supply of them to change whenever needed. We wash them together (in a separate load) with warm water and a mild natural detergent..along with a moderate amount of "Clorox" Ultimate Care Bleach...and dry them with medium heat in the dryer. They come out dazzling white...and the strips of color stay bright and beautiful! If you fold them right away, they will be wrinkle-free. Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: J.J.

customer_reviews.title: Definitely a quality towel
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I have purchased these towels. I embroider the towels and convert them into gifts. They are wonderful to work on and following the provided washing instructions they wash and dry with a minimum of shrinkage, and they iron up nicely. The colored stripes are on the vertical edges leaving a large area in the middle to embroider. Really like the fact that they are 100% cotton. I have and will continue to purchase these repeatedly.
customer_reviews.author: NewToTablets

customer_reviews.title: Quality towels, affordable price!
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful towels! This is my second order as the quality is excellent and I've given several away with baked goods. Towels dry items well with little or no lint, I use them to set jars on when I'm canning, and I also use them as "hot pads" for pans and casseroles. Again, excellent quality that I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: Not one of the best dish towels I’ve used.
customer_reviews.text: The dish towels arrived packaged nicely for a gift. But that is not what I ordered them for I ordered them to be used I’m not that impressed they are not as observant as I feel they should be when I wash them and place them in the dryer on low they still become wrinkled I don’t think I would buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: J. Walton

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality Dish Towels
customer_reviews.text: Bought 12 and only used 6 in 2 years. They get a workout in my kitchen and have been washed over 100 times each. The 6 towels have since been moved to the garage and are used to wash the cars and do other tasks. I hope to get 2 more years in my kitchen from the remaining 6 towels. The only con is they have some light stains that don't come out in the wash.
customer_reviews.author: Billy21

customer_reviews.title: What can I say, "I love these towels".
customer_reviews.text: Extreamly good quality, great to have and use in kitchen. Perfect size to cover stand mixer and other counter top appliances when not in use, very soft and asorbent. I have mostly been using them to dry hands, dishes and vegetables, (not having to use so many paper towels is a plus). Also been using them to cover dough while proofing. After having been washed a few times they still look and feel like new. Don't know what else to say about these tea towels, just that I'm really happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: M Harrington

customer_reviews.title: Nice size, minimal shrinkage, good thickness, great towels
customer_reviews.text: Love the size and absorbency. Dry very well and the color stripe holds up well to bleach. But of course they wrinkle, they are cotton. I would expect them too. But its not terrible, just expected. Love these towels, they have really helped me reduce my paper towel usage. I even use them as oversized napkins often
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Tightly woven cotton towels
customer_reviews.text: I like the tight weave of these towels and the herringbone appearance. They are well made, except three of the towels had uneven hems which does not affect their usefulness. They wash well but do dry a bit crinkly; no huge wrinkles though. I did iron them because I like freshly ironed things, but it is not necessary for kitchen use. I wanted an alternative to paper towels since paper products are hard to come by during this pandemic, and I may just adopt this new habit for the foreseeable future. These towels remind me of the towels my mother and grandmother used in my distant past.
customer_reviews.author: D. B. Joyce

customer_reviews.title: Good Size and Quality
customer_reviews.text: I rate kitchen towels not only by utility but how much they shrink after washing in hot water. The towels improved with washing becoming more absorbent and with minimal shrinkage (less than 10%). I was surprised they came all the way from England which is a nice surprise after so much from China. They are made in Pakistan but obviously had to get passed finicky English tastes first. They certainly passed my own personal quality test (I am picky about value paid) and I can safely say I would buy again without hesitation. Well done mates!
customer_reviews.author: Edlyn

customer_reviews.title: GREAT TOWELS
customer_reviews.text: WHEN I RECEIVED THEM I WASHED THEM PER YOUR INSTRUCTIONS AND OF COURSE DRIED THEM,THEY CAME OUT OF THE DRIER WRINKLE FREE.THEY ARE WONDERFUL.I REALLY DO LIKE THEM A LOT AND I LIKE THE SIZE OF THEM.I AM SO GLAD THAT I CHOSE THEM.I WOULD RECOMMEND THEM TO MY FRIENDS.THANK YOU SO MUCH. J.BROWN
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My favorite kitchen towels, hands down.
customer_reviews.text: These are my favorite kitchen towels ever. The fabric weave is nicely absorbent without being linty and bleaches beautifully in the wash without fading the pretty trim colors. I hang them to dry so that they don’t wrinkle and I have two sets so there is always a fresh, clean dry towel at hand. I love them!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Laura

customer_reviews.title: 12 dish towel bundle
customer_reviews.text: Good value for what they are. I'd buy again. For intended use, -- what you'd want. If had no color could serve hot bread if were inclinded to do so. If not concerned with any cloth dye, -- can be used for that too, so a bonus imo.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon_User

customer_reviews.title: Top Notch Dish Towels
customer_reviews.text: These are great dish towels and exactly what I was looking for. I just completed a kitchen renovation with Taj Mahal quartzite countertops, Kohler deep double sink and a stunning California Davoli kitchen faucet. I wanted a set of towels that looked nice and functional. I use them to keep the countertops clean and the faucet sparkling. They pull the water off my dishes very nicely. These are top notch dish towels.
customer_reviews.author: B. Daniels

customer_reviews.title: Towels for life!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! I washed it once it came in and followed the instructions. It came out perfectly fine! I'm a customer for life man! I'm going to get good use out of these amazing towels. I will buy some for my mom for mother's day too!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Lane

customer_reviews.title: wedding gift
customer_reviews.text: I really like the weight and appearance of these towels. They were gift ready upon arrival but I have washed them so I can embroider on them to give my niece as part of her wedding gift. They wrinkled once they were washed but ironed nicely to allow for the embroidery. I will buy these towels again.
customer_reviews.author: debbie

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: I would never have thought that I would write a review for kitchen towels but I must admit these are beautiful! Impressive packaging and lovely kitchen towels. I think I'm going to display them in a basket as one purchaser suggested, they are that nice. Beautiful colors and a great size. Very pleased
customer_reviews.author: october

customer_reviews.title: Love these towels!
customer_reviews.text: I really love these towels. I bought them to embroider, and they worked great for that. I washed them before and after embroidering. Instructions said not to wash and dry hot, but that is the way I wash my towels after using, so I just went ahead and washed as usual .They shrank about an inch in length, but were still a plenty long I also kept a few to use myself, and they do a great job of drying dishes. I had ordered other towels that looked similar in pictures and were less expensive, but they were of poor quality. (Thinner and shrink.) I ordered another set of the Harringdons, and same great service, same great towels.
customer_reviews.author: Pattie Fietz

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely the best!
customer_reviews.text: When I first tried to get these towels, they were not available on Amazon. The minute they became available, I ordered them. As soon as I got them, I ordered a set for each of my three adult children. We are all so pleased. Brings back another era when things were well made-tough and beautiful. Get them because you deserve to have something both fine and simple in these difficult times.
customer_reviews.author: Decarcerate

customer_reviews.title: Not very absorbent at all
customer_reviews.text: These towels are almost water repellent, the opposite of what I was seeking in a dish towel.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Strong. Look good.
customer_reviews.text: Absorbency ok. Although wrinkled after washing, could be folded. We are more particular and feel they should be ironed. But that’s us! We will still make use of them. They are strong.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: rippoff
customer_reviews.text: paper thin. like one ply toilet paper. useless. not even a shop rag
customer_reviews.author: Joseph K.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality towel
customer_reviews.text: I got these to use as dish towels, and I love them. They do wrinkle a tiny bit, and they did shrink a tiny bit, but that doesn't matter to me because I got them to use. I can't imagine a 100% cotton towel not shrinking a bit, or wrinkling a bit. Both were minimal. I'd recommend these to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: AK Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Waterproof till several washs
customer_reviews.text: They don t absorb water o liquids. Beautiful but useless. waterproof I can say... perhaps they will be absorbentes when used. I washed them several times. And after more than 20 wash they absorb.. very surprised because I ve read several reviews before buying. Very good presentation and beautiful.
customer_reviews.author: julieta

customer_reviews.title: Pretty and absorbable
customer_reviews.text: I had a bunch of towels in my kitchen that never seemed to dry anything well. I chose these as a replacement because they were similar to ones I used to have and loved. I like these just as much. They are absorbent and attractive and a nice size. I washed them when they came, and they didn't get excessively wrinkled. Great buy for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki LF

product_meta.title: Harringdons Kitchen Dish Towels Set of 12-Tea Towels 100% Cotton. Large Dish Cloths 28"x20" Soft and Absorbent. White with Blue, Green and red Stripes, 4 of Each. There's no Substitute for Quality
product_meta.description:
The Best Kitchen Dish Towels for you and your kitchen.

Add warmth and beauty to your kitchen now.

Are your dish towels too small and falling apart? 
Are you bored with just one color? 
Can’t find quality tea towels that would complement your kitchen and dinner table? 

Then Harringdons 100% cotton dish/tea towels are a MUST buy now!

- Superior stitching and hemming so ends will not unravel with everyday use. 
- Made with sustainable, eco-friendly 100% cotton in herringbone weave. 
- Minimal lint so dries and sparkles. 
- Machine washable and bleach safe, with minimal shrinkage. 
- Comes in a pack of 12 with three lovely colors: blue, green and red, 4 of each in a pack. 
- Generous size: 28"x20". Ship size is 30"x20" to account for shrinkage. 

Don’t just dry dishes enjoy multiple uses:

- Keep bread soft and warm. 
- Natural alternative to plastic food wrap. 
- Use as kitchen gloves to handle hot plates. 
- Nice to dry fresh fruit and vegetables with. 
- Absorbent so loves spills and messes. Wash before use at 40C and best to natural dry or at low heat. Do not use fabric softener. Natural fibres will shrink after first wash.

These kitchen towels are manufactured using state of the art technology by certified manufacturing facilities.

It is important for us that you are completely happy and satisfied with our dish towels. If for any reason you are not we will give you a FULL REFUND under our 100% MONEY-BACK GUARANTEE POLICY.

Special introduction price on offer for a limited period: join the increasing list of happy customers and Click "Add to Cart" now.
feature_bullets: Dish towels that are Eco-friendly. The green alternative to paper towels. Made with sustainable, environment friendly cotton for daily use.
Machine washable and lint free - Commercial grade hemming prevents unraveling after multiple washes. World class quality suitable for hotels and homes.

Size does matter. Large vintage Dish Cloths: 28”x20”- Unlike many competing towels, Harringdons tea towels are made in a generous size according to our strict specifications giving you best value and quality. Professional quality with a minimum weight of 230 gsm in Herringbone weave.
Multiple Usage - Use for drying, wrapping bread, cleaning spills or put it in your picnic hamper. Great for embroidery and crafts. Makes a lovely gift for a loved one.
Add color to your kitchen - enjoy THREE different tones of color in one set. Each towel comes with a corner hanging loop.
